answers.answer: Well, depends on if you're talking about a lumbar puncture, or a needle biopsy of another part of your body.  Please elaborate on which one they're going to do, and where, so you can get proper feedback from us.  But I can tell you that if they're doing a needle biopsy of, say, your thigh, it won't hurt any more than a regular shot.  Just focus on how the results are going to lead to proper treatment and thus relief from the problems you have now.  And you can always ask for a tranquilizer just before the procedure, if they'll allow it, to keep you calm about the whole situation.
They are taking it from my arm and leg, I don't think they are using a needle, the doctor said somethng about using a tool that cuts off part of the skin.

I had a skin punch done for autonomic neuropathy.  Didn't hurt at all when it was done.  The three spots were a little sore the next day, and then about a week later they were itchy as the scabs started to come off.  Eash spot was maybe a quarter inch circle.  The only surprise for me was that I couldn't get the spots wet for 24 hours, so don't let the day before be the day you decide not to bother with a shower :)
Thankyou so much!!!!!!  That's exactly what I'm having mine for.  That sounds pretty simple.  :)

title: Skin Punch Biopsy
